itemType.name: Dinosaur Part
entries: Dinosaur hides and eggs can be sold in Port Nyanzaru to various merchants. The hides of harder-to-kill dinosaurs go for substantial gold, since they are obtained at high personal risk. The hides are sold as art to the wealthy or turned into armor for soldiers and adventurers.

Dinosaur eggs are often more valuable than hides, since to have any hope of training a dinosaur, one must begin with a hatchling. Dinosaur racers and merchants with a need for pack animals are particularly interested in obtaining the eggs.

trait.name: Cling
entries: If the allosaurus zombie hits a creature with a claw attack, that target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the allosaurus zombie can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Undying Hunger (1/Turn)
entries: If the allosaurus zombie hits a creature with a claw attack, the allosaurus zombie gains 5 temporary hit points.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The archelon can hold its breath for 6 hours.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

entries: If the archelon zombie hits a creature with a bite attack, the archelon zombie gains 5 temporary hit points.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Stomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}34 ({@damage 5d10 + 7}) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}40 ({@damage 6d10 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Stomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}34 ({@damage 5d10 + 7}) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}40 ({@damage 6d10 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Poison Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The brachiosaurus zombie exhales poison gas in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 45 ({@damage 10d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Stomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 5d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}32 ({@damage 6d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Pounce
entries: If the deinonychus zombie moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the deinonychus zombie can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Undying Hunger (1/Turn)
entries: If the deinonychus zombie hits a creature with a claw attack, the deinonychus zombie gains 5 temporary hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The deinonychus zombie makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Venomous Spit
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 10/20 ft., one target. {@h}The target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition blinded} for 1 minute. A {@condition blinded} creature must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn, becoming {@condition paralyzed} for as long as it remains {@condition blinded} on a failure or ending the {@condition blinded} condition on a success. A {@condition blinded} and {@condition paralyzed} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of its turn, ending both conditions on a success. Creatures immune to the {@condition poisoned} condition are immune to this effect.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Necrotic Spit
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 2} to hit, range 10/20 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition blinded} for 1 minute. A {@condition blinded} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of its turn, ending the condition on a success.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The giganotosaurus can make two attacks: one with its bite and one with its tail. It can use Swallow instead of its bite.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}34 ({@damage 4d12 + 8}) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 18}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the giganotosaurus can't bite another target.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}26 ({@damage 4d8 + 8}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Swallow
entries: The giganotosaurus makes one bite attack against a Large or smaller creature it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target takes the bite's damage, the target is swallowed, and the grapple ends.

While swallowed, the creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the giganotosaurus, and it takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the giganotosaurus' turns.

If the giganotosaurus takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the giganotosaurus must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the giganotosaurus. If the giganotosaurus dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 30 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

legendary.name: Momentum
entries: The giganotosaurus moves its speed.

legendary.name: Tail Sweep (2 Actions)
entries: The giganotosaurus sweeps its tail in a 20-foot cone. Each creature in the cone must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

legendary.name: Roar (3 Actions)
entries: Creatures within 20 feet of the giganotosaurus that can hear it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} of the giganotosaurus until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Disgorge Zombie
entries: As a bonus action, the giganotosaurus zombie can disgorge a normal {@creature zombie}, which appears in an unoccupied space within 15 feet of it. The disgorged {@creature zombie} acts on its own initiative count. After a {@creature zombie} is disgorged, roll a {@dice d6}. On a roll of 1, the giganotosaurus zombie runs out of {@creature zombie||zombies} to disgorge and loses this trait. On a roll of 6, the next zombie the giganotosaurus zombie disgorges is an {@creature ogre zombie}. If the giganotosaurus zombie still has this trait when it dies, {@dice 1d4} normal {@creature zombie||zombies} erupt from its corpse at the start of its next turn. These {@creature zombie||zombies} act on their own initiative counts.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The giganotosaurus zombie can make two attacks: one with its bite and one with its tail. It can use Swallow instead of its bite.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}34 ({@damage 4d12 + 8}) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 18}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the giganotosaurus zombie can't bite another target.

action.name: Swallow
entries: The giganotosaurus zombie makes one bite attack against a Large or smaller creature it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target takes the bite's damage, the target is swallowed, and the grapple ends.

While swallowed, the creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the giganotosaurus zombie, and it takes 18 ({@damage 4d6}) poison damage at the start of each of the giganotosaurus zombie's turns. A creature that dies while swallowed becomes a zombie the giganotosaurus zombie can disgorge at the start of the giganotosaurus zombie's next turn.

If the giganotosaurus zombie takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the giganotosaurus zombie must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the giganotosaurus zombie. If the giganotosaurus zombie dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 30 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

legendary.name: Disgorge Zombie

action.name: Swallow

While swallowed, the creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the mosasaurus, and it takes 17 ({@damage 5d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the mosasaurus' turns.

If the mosasaurus takes 25 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the mosasaurus must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the mosasaurus. action.name: Swallow
entries: The mosasaurus zombie makes one bite attack against a Medium or smaller creature it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target takes the bite's damage, the target is swallowed, and the grapple ends.

While swallowed, the creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the mosasaurus zombie, and it takes 17 ({@damage 5d6}) necrotic damage at the start of each of the mosasaurus zombie's turns.

If the mosasaurus zombie takes 25 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the mosasaurus zombie must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the mosasaurus zombie. If the mosasaurus zombie dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 30 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

entries: The nemicolopterus has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in jungle and forest terrain.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the pachycephalosaurus moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a ram attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 5 ({@damage 2d4}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Ram
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

entries: If the pachycephalosaurus zombie moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a ram attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 5 ({@damage 2d4}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or it is {@condition poisoned} until the end of the pachycephalosaurus zombie's next turn.

entries: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Terrestrial Leap
entries: If the pteranodon zombie moves at least 10 feet toward a target and then hits with a bite attack on the same turn, the attack deals an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) damage to the target.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Undying Hunger (1/Turn)
entries: If the pteranodon zombie hits a creature with a bite attack, the pteranodon zombie gains 5 temporary hit points.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 2d4 + 1}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The quetzalcoatlus zombie's long jump is up to 30 feet and its high jump is up to 15 feet, with or without a running start.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Undying Hunger (1/Turn)
entries: If the quetzalcoatlus zombie hits a creature with a bite attack, the quetzalcoatlus zombie gains 5 temporary hit points.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 3d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Deadly Leap
entries: If the quetzalcoatlus zombie jumps at least 15 feet as part of its movement, it can then use this action to land on its feet in a space that contains one or more other creatures. Each of those creatures must succeed on a {@dc 12} Strength or Dexterity saving throw (target's choice) or be knocked {@condition prone} and take 12 ({@damage 3d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage plus 12 ({@damage 3d6 + 2}) slashing damage. On a successful save, the creature takes only half the damage, isn't knocked {@condition prone}, and is pushed 5 feet out of the quetzalcoatlus zombie's space into an unoccupied space of the creature's choice. If no unoccupied space is within range, the creature instead falls {@condition prone} in the quetzalcoatlus zombie's space.

trait.name: Hold Breath

entries: Water within 20 feet of the sarcosuchus zombie is tainted with toxins. A creature that enters or starts its turn in that water must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or it is {@condition poisoned} until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny nemicolopterus. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage, or 3 ({@damage 1d6}) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

trait.name: Swarm

If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

legendary.name: Momentum
entries: The titanosaurus moves half its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Tough Defense (2 Actions)
entries: The titanosaurus picks one of the following damage types and is resistant to that type of damage until the start of its next turn: bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing.

legendary.name: Tail Thunder (3 Actions)
entries: The titanosaurus makes a tail attack with disadvantage against each creature in a 20-foot cone.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Stomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}40 ({@damage 6d10 + 7}) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}45 ({@damage 7d10 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

legendary.name: Flesh Drop
entries: The titanosaurus zombie chooses one Medium or smaller creature within 10 feet of it that it can see. That creature must succeed on a {@dc 10} Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition restrained} in a mote of the titanosaurus zombie's flesh that has separated from its body. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of its turn, ending the effect on a success.

legendary.name: Poison Gas (2 Actions)
entries: The titanosaurus zombie breathes gas in a 30-foot cone. Creatures in the area must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. Creatures {@condition poisoned} this way can repeat the saving throw at the end of their turns, ending the effect on a success.

legendary.name: Tail Thunder (3 Actions)
entries: The titanosaurus makes a tail attack with disadvantage against each creature in a 20-foot cone.

trait.name: Trampling Charge
entries: If the triceratops zombie moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the triceratops zombie can make one stop attack against it as a bonus action.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 4d8 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Stomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one {@condition prone} creature. {@h}22 ({@damage 3d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Improved Critical
entries: The troodon scores a critical hit with its bite on a roll of 19 or 20.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The troodon has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the troodon's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Improved Critical
entries: The troodon zombie scores a critical hit with its bite on a roll of 19 or 20.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The troodon zombie has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the troodon zombie's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d10 + 1}) piercing damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} until the end of the troodon zombie's next turn.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The velociraptor zombie has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the velociraptor zombie's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Undying Hunger (1/Turn)
entries: If the velociraptor zombie hits a creature with a bite attack, the velociraptor zombie gains 5 temporary hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The velociraptor zombie makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Pounce
entries: If the zealoraptor moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the zealoraptor can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The zealoraptor has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the zealoraptor's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The zealoraptor makes one bite and one claw attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit. 9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Pounce
entries: If the zealoraptor zombie moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the zealoraptor zombie can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The zealoraptor makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit. 8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage and the creature must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or contract {@disease sewer plague|DMG} (see the "{@disease Sewer Plague|DMG}" sidebar or {@book "Diseases" in chapter 8, "Running the Game" of the Dungeon Master's Guide|DMG|8|Diseases}).

monsterFluff.name: Allosaurus Zombie
entries: This zombie retains much of the savage ferocity it had in life.

monsterFluff.name: Archelon
entries: This enormous sea turtle weighs more than 4,500 pounds. Its soft shell allows it to swim at great speeds as it chases prey through the shallow sea. The turtle prefers to eat jellyfish, but makes a meal of any slow-moving meat in its territory.

monsterFluff.name: Archelon Zombie
entries: This enormous raft of undead flesh pollutes shallow seas, attacking any living creature it can find. It seems to never tire of filling its dead belly.

monsterFluff.name: Brachiosaurus
entries: Larger than even the {@creature brontosaurus|VGM}, the brachiosaurus is one of the heaviest known dinosaurs. Woe to any creature that disturbs the long-necked herbivore, as its powerful tail and massive feet easily crush even large predators.

monsterFluff.name: Brachiosaurus Zombie
entries: This powerful creature emits noxious gas from its forehead nostrils and haunts forgotten jungles.

monsterFluff.name: Brontosaurus Zombie
entries: Brontosaurus zombies thunder through the world, barely aware of their surroundings, but harboring an burning hatred for the living.

monsterFluff.name: Deinonychus Zombie
entries: Deinonychus zombies retain some of their agility and still hunt in packs, seeking to tear flesh from living bones.

monsterFluff.name: Dilophosaurus
entries: This human-sized, bipedal carnivore sports rounded crests along its nose. It can spit a powerful venom that blinds and paralyzes its prey.

entries.name: Venomous Dilophosaurus
entries: There is no evidence in the real world that dilophosaurus was venomous. Many fictional stories embellish the dinosaur's ability to do this, since there is no evidence that it couldn't spit venom either. The version of the dilophosaurus presented here borrows from those pop culture tales and spits venom to make the dinosaur unique.

monsterFluff.name: Dilophosaurus Zombie
entries: This zombie spits a necrotic slime instead of venom.

monsterFluff.name: Dimetrodon Zombie
entries: Dimetrodon zombie herds haunt shallow rivers.

monsterFluff.name: Giganotosaurus
entries: Larger and faster than the {@creature Tyrannosaurus Rex|MM|tyrannosaurus}, giganotosaurus is a bipedal carnivore that rules any area it decides is its territory. These creatures are extremely rare, living alone and mating only once every few years. No one has ever raised a giganotosaurus from birth, so its eggs are incredibly valuable.

monsterFluff.name: Giganotosaurus Zombie
entries: Giganotosaurus zombies have gullets full of smaller zombies, like tyrannosaurus zombies.

monsterFluff.name: Hadrosaurus Zombie
entries: Hadrosaurus zombies roam the wildnerness in slow packs, only stopping to kill.

monsterFluff.name: Mosasaurus
entries: This 50-foot-long aquatic carnivore has a bullet-shaped body and long, crocodillian jaws. It hunts in the deep sea, swimming with grace and speed.

monsterFluff.name: Mosasaurus Zombie
entries: A mosasaurus zombie has necrotic energy boiling in its stomach, waiting to be set free in a belch.

monsterFluff.name: Nemicolopterus
entries: One of the smallest flying reptiles, nemicolopterus, lives in trees nears streams and hunts small fish. Swarms of the dinosaurs attack when larger predators invade their territory.

monsterFluff.name: Nemicolopterus Zombie
entries: Nemicolopterus zombies live deep in jungle ruins, waiting to feast on the flesh of the living.

monsterFluff.name: Pachycephalosaurus
entries: This bipedal, herbivorous dinosaur has a dome-shaped skull it bashes against other pachycephalosaurus when competing for mates. It also slams its head into predators when threatened.

monsterFluff.name: Pachycephalosaurus Zombie
entries: This creature hits as fast and hard as it ever did with its exposed skull.

monsterFluff.name: Plesiosaurus Zombie
entries: The plesiosaurus zombie is known to hunt in ocean areas polluted with garbage.

monsterFluff.name: Pteranodon Zombie
entries: Pteranodon zombies hunt jungles at night in packs and glide as silent at death.

monsterFluff.name: Quetzalcoatlus Zombie
entries: These massive zombies lose their ability to fly, but can make incredible leaps using what is left of their shredded wings. Quetzalcoatlus zombies' bones break in horrid ways to allow them to move faster on the ground than their living counterparts.

monsterFluff.name: Sarcosuchus
entries: Over 40 feet long, this enormous crocodile is surprisingly stealthy, ambushing prey in murky freshwater.

monsterFluff.name: Sarcosuchus Zombie
entries: This enormous undead crocodile turns water it touches toxic.

monsterFluff.name: Stegosaurus Zombie
entries: This plodding behemoth seems to seek out and murder living stegosauruses, leaving corpses a trail of corpses behind it as it travels the jungle.

monsterFluff.name: Therizinosaurus
entries: This bipedal herbivore has the longest claws of any dinosaur. It uses them to tear the leaves off trees and protect itself from predators who invade its territory.

monsterFluff.name: Therizinosaurus Zombie
entries: This zombie's claws are coated with a powerful paralyzing fluid.

monsterFluff.name: Titanosaurus
entries: Also called the argentinosaurus, this is the largest known dinosaur. Its intimidating 130-foot length and overwhelming 220,000-pound weight mean the titanosaurus almost never needs to use its massive feet and tail to defend itself.

monsterFluff.name: Titanosaurus Zombie
entries: The titanosaurus zombie can drop sticky hunks of dead flesh that surround and trap enemies.

monsterFluff.name: Triceratops Zombie
entries: A triceratops zombie may seem totally unaware, but when it notices a living creature, the undead beast charges forth with a fury it never had in life.

monsterFluff.name: Troodon
entries: Considered the most intelligent dinosaurs, troodons are feathered omnivores with prominent, serrated teeth. The halfling-sized dinosaurs hunt together in packs and set ambushes for their prey.

monsterFluff.name: Troodon Zombie
entries: Troodon zombies retain their ability to fight well in packs.

monsterFluff.name: Velociraptor Zombie
entries: These creatures haunt ancient ruins in massive numbers.

monsterFluff.name: Zealoraptor
entries: At 7 feet long and over 1,000 pounds, the zealoraptor (aka utahraptor) is a terrible beast to behold. Often just called raptors, these bipedal carnivores are clever, silent, swift pack hunters with large claws on their feet.

monsterFluff.name: Zealoraptor Zombie
entries: A zealoraptor zombie's claws are coated in fluids that cause disease.

table.name: Additional Racing Dinosaurs
footnotes: * If an {@skill Animal Handling} check made with advantage due to lashing fails by 5 or more, the animal goes berserk and is out of the race.

table.name: Expanded Zombies
rows: {@dice 2d6} {@creature Swarm of Nemicolopterus Zombies|DDHC-TOA-3|nemicolopterus zombie swarms}

book.name: DDHC-TOA-3: Beasts of the Jungle Rot
book.author: James Introcaso, Ruty Rutenberg

entries.title: DDHC-TOA-3: Beasts of the Jungle Rot Cover

entries: Unleash new dinosaurs and undead thunder lizards in this supplement for the world's greatest roleplaying game.

entries.name: Designers

entries.title: DDHC-TOA-3: Beasts of the Jungle Rot Cover Art

data.name: Dinosaurs
entries: Monsters that lived in the real world. That's what dinosaurs are. The release of {@adventure Tomb of Annihilation|ToA} allows a chance to get up close and personal with the extinct beasts that sold millions of toys and inspired as many elementary school science projects. Big, small, carnivorous, or herbivorous, dinosaurs capture our imaginations from the time we're young and never let go.

This document contains statistics for new dinosaurs and zombie dinosaurs for use in any {@i Dungeons & Dragons} game and additional material that can be added to any {@adventure Tomb of Annihilation|ToA} campaign or modified for any adventure that features dinosaurs.

entries.name: New Dinosaurs
entries: The {@book Monster Manual|MM} and {@book Volo's Guide to Monsters|VGM} provide statistics for various kinds of dinosaurs. This document provides several more.

entries.name: Archelon
entries: This enormous sea turtle weighs more than 4,500 pounds. Its soft shell allows it to swim at great speeds as it chases prey through the shallow sea. The turtle prefers to eat jellyfish, but makes a meal of any slow-moving meat in its territory.

entries.name: Brachiosaurus
entries: Larger than even the {@creature brontosaurus|VGM}, the brachiosaurus is one of the heaviest known dinosaurs. Woe to any creature that disturbs the long-necked herbivore, as its powerful tail and massive feet easily crush even large predators.

entries.name: Dilophosaurus
entries: This human-sized, bipedal carnivore sports rounded crests along its nose. It can spit a powerful venom that blinds and paralyzes its prey.

entries.name: Venomous Dilophosaurus
entries: There is no evidence in the real world that dilophosaurus was venomous. Many fictional stories embellish the dinosaur's ability to do this, since there is no evidence that it couldn't spit venom either. The version of the dilophosaurus presented here borrows from those pop culture tales and spits venom to make the dinosaur unique.

entries.name: Giganotosaurus
entries: Larger and faster than the {@creature Tyrannosaurus Rex|MM|tyrannosaurus}, giganotosaurus is a bipedal carnivore that rules any area it decides is its territory. These creatures are extremely rare, living alone and mating only once every few years. No one has ever raised a giganotosaurus from birth, so its eggs are incredibly valuable.

entries.name: Mosasaurus
entries: This 50-foot-long aquatic carnivore has a bullet-shaped body and long, crocodillian jaws. It hunts in the deep sea, swimming with grace and speed.

entries.name: Nemicolopterus
entries: One of the smallest flying reptiles, nemicolopterus, lives in trees nears streams and hunts small fish. Swarms of the dinosaurs attack when larger predators invade their territory.

entries.name: Pachycephalosaurus
entries: This bipedal, herbivorous dinosaur has a dome-shaped skull it bashes against other pachycephalosaurus when competing for mates. It also slams its head into predators when threatened.

entries.name: Sarcosuchus
entries: Over 40 feet long, this enormous crocodile is surprisingly stealthy, ambushing prey in murky freshwater.

entries.name: Therizinosaurus
entries: This bipedal herbivore has the longest claws of any dinosaur. It uses them to tear the leaves off trees and protect itself from predators who invade its territory.

entries.name: Titanosaurus
entries: Also called the argentinosaurus, this is the largest known dinosaur. Its intimidating 130-foot length and overwhelming 220,000-pound weight mean the titanosaurus almost never needs to use its massive feet and tail to defend itself.

entries.name: Troodon
entries: Considered the most intelligent dinosaurs, troodons are feathered omnivores with prominent, serrated teeth. The halfling-sized dinosaurs hunt together in packs and set ambushes for their prey.

entries.name: Zealoraptor
entries: At 7 feet long and over 1,000 pounds, the zealoraptor (aka utahraptor) is a terrible beast to behold. Often just called raptors, these bipedal carnivores are clever, silent, swift pack hunters with large claws on their feet.

entries.name: Those Aren't Dinosaurs!
entries: You may be reading this document thinking {@creature archelon|DDHC-TOA-3}, {@creature nemicolopterus|DDHC-TOA-3}, {@creature mosasaurus|DDHC-TOA-3}, and {@creature sarcosuchus|DDHC-TOA-3} are not dinosaurs, and you'd be correct in real-world scientific terms. In terms of game simplicity, it makes sense to classify these ancient reptiles that existed alongside the dinosaurs as such, especially since they aren't any less exciting to use in your game.

entries.name: Zombie Dinosaurs
entries: {@adventure Tomb of Annihilation|ToA} provides statistics for the {@creature Ankylosaurus Zombie|ToA|ankylosaurus} and {@creature Tyrannosaurus Zombie|ToA|tyrannosaurus zombies}. This document provides more dinosaur zombies. For more information on zombies, see the {@book Monster Manual|MM}.

entries: This zombie retains much of the savage ferocity it had in life.

data.name: Tomb of Annihilation Additions
entries: If you're playing {@adventure Tomb of Annihilation|ToA}, you can add the creatures found in this document into the adventure using the following supplemental information.

entries.name: Dinosaur Hunts
entries: Dinosaur hides and eggs can be sold in Port Nyanzaru to various merchants. The hides of harder-to-kill dinosaurs go for substantial gold, since they are obtained at high personal risk. The hides are sold as art to the wealthy or turned into armor for soldiers and adventurers.

Dinosaur eggs are often more valuable than hides, since to have any hope of training a dinosaur, one must begin with a hatchling. Dinosaur racers and merchants with a need for pack animals are particularly interested in obtaining the eggs.

To track a specific type of dinosaur through the jungle or at sea, a character must spend {@dice 1d10} days in the wilderness searching and succeed on a Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) check as shown on the {@table Dinosaur Hunt|DDHC-TOA-3} table. If this check fails, a character must spend another {@dice 1d10} days traversing the wilderness looking for the specific type of dinosaur and repeat the ability check.

A successful check means the character tracks the dinosaur to its lair. The {@table Dinosaur Hunt|DDHC-TOA-3} table shows the number of dinosaurs and eggs within a lair and how much each dinosaur's hide and eggs are worth. If adventurers flood the market with a specific type of dinosaur hides or eggs, it could reduce the price of the product at the DM's discretion.

When harvesting the hide of a dinosaur, it takes 5 minutes to skin a Tiny dinosaur, 10 minutes to skin a Small dinosaur, 30 minutes to skin a Medium dinosaur, 1 hour to skin a Large dinosaur, 8 hours to skin a Huge dinosaur, and 1 day to skin a Gargantuan dinosaur. A character trained in {@skill Survival} only requires half the time to properly harvest a dinosaur hide.

entries.name: Random Encounters
entries: Whenever you roll for a random encounter on the {@adventure Wilderness Encounters table in appendix B, "Random Encounters,"|ToA|7|Wilderness Encounters} of Tomb of Annihilation that includes a dinosaur (see appendix B), you can substitute any of the dinosaurs of a similar challenge rating in this document for the dinosaurs in the adventure. If you roll for this encounter in the Lesser Undead or Greater Undead areas of the jungle, you can instead substitute any of the dinosaur zombies in this document.

If your encounter result is "undead, zombies," instead of rolling a {@dice d10} as described in {@adventure Tomb of Annihilation|ToA}, roll on the {@table Expanded Zombies|DDHC-TOA-3} table in this document to determine what appears.

entries.name: Dinosaur Racing
entries: The {@table Additional Racing Dinosaurs|DDHC-TOA-3} table can be used if the characters decide to race dinosaurs (see {@adventure "Dinosaur Racing" in chapter 1, "Port Nyanzaru," in Tomb of Annihilation|ToA|1|Dinosaur Racing}).
